content: Is it possible to set User avatars on the server and disable Users from changing them?
No. There are options to prevent users from changing their email and name though.
@Ste-IT What is your use case?
If it was to be used for internal communications in a company for example, like skype for business, it would be useful to be able to set avatars without having to get every user to do it themself
or if there was some scriptable way of doing it
I am not sure whether we have a management command for that but it is defintely not hard to write one if you want :)
oh that'd be awesome, can you point me in the right direction please?
Can you tell me a bit more about how your script will work? For example how will you let the script know what image should it set?
we have all the photos as username.jpg or .png
ignoring the @domain
even if it was just set user.a@domain.com user.a.png would be fantastic
i have them all in a folder on the zulip server, but not under the zulip user because i wasnt sure where to put them
Cool. Let me go through the codebase.
thank you so much

hmm. Going through the code it looks like it can be done easily by iterating through all the userprofiles which have domain.com domain, reading the file from disk and setting the avatar by calling the 2 apparopriate functions. Can you wait for a couple of hours till @Tim Abbott comes online? It's not common to use custom scripts for doing things in Zulip to avoid any unwanted side effects. I just want to make sure that this is the right thing to do.
sure no problem
i really appreciate the help :)
if the user picture is stored in AD/LDAP then there should be a mapping in settings that we could use to automatically populate the user avatar?
Just a crazy thought :)
i can get it in AD if that makes it easier
I've definitely been wanting to build support for syncing these profile pictures from LDAP.
is there an easy way to do it now do you think?
or does it probably require a lot of work?
@Ste-IT it wouldn't take long for a programmer to write this. if you're interested in doing the work, I can post notes on what's involved.
@Tim Abbott yes please
thank you :)
